intro: Fumana gonzagae, commonly known as the Gonzaga's fumana, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
